DOC.brief_summary: Background : Smokers attend outpatient clinic present excellent 'teachable moment ' smoke cessation intervention . This protocol paper describe rationale method large randomize controlled trial aim evaluate effectiveness negotiate self-determination reduce cigarette consumption among smoker attend outpatient clinic Methods : A randomized control trial conduct 10 out-patient clinic Hong Kong . Subjects intervention group receive brief intervention smoke reduction plus smoking reduction leaflet . Additionally , subject ask think smoke reduction schedule negotiation counsellor . Subjects control group receive brief advice quit plus leaflet smoking cessation . Four consecutive ( 1 , 3 , 6 12 month ) follow-up conduct . The primary outcome measure biochemically validate abstinence 6 month . Secondary outcome : ( ) biochemically validate abstinence 12 month , ( ii ) self-reported 7-day point prevalence abstinence 6 12 month , ( iii ) self-reported reduction ≥ 50 % cigarette consumption 6 12 month , ( iv ) self-efficacy tobacco 6 12 month .
